title: MySQLCURRENT_USER()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLCURRENT_USER()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the user name and host name for the MySQL account:
SELECT CURRENT_USER();

Definition and Usage
The CURRENT_USER() function returns the user name and host name for the MySQL 
account that the server used to authenticate the current client.
The result is returned as a string in the UTF8 character 
set.
Tip:
See also the
USER()
function.
Syntax
CURRENT_USER()
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0

★
+1
